title: U.S. Strike Kills 11 in Caribbean, Escalating Tensions with Venezuela
snippets: Trump says, ‘We took it out,’ referring to a military strike in international waters amid Washington-Caracas tensions.
Donald Trump says a US strike has killed 11 ‘narcoterrorists’ from a Venezuelan gang smuggling drugs in the Caribbean.

Trump says ‘we took it out’ referring to the operation in international waters, amid US-Caracas tensions

The US military has killed 11 drug traffickers from Venezuela during a “a kinetic strike” in the Caribbean Sea, the US president, Donald Trump, has claimed amid growing tensions between
The attack is a dramatic escalation that coincides with the administration’s growing counternarcotics focus and its intensifying feud with the Venezuelan leader, Nicolás Maduro.
The vessel was transporting illegal narcotics through international waters to the United States, the president said.
titles: How did US strike on Venezuelan boat come about? What it means
Trump says US strike targeted Venezuelan drug smuggling boat
US conducts ‘kinetic strike’ against drug boat from Venezuela, killing 11, Trump says
U.S. kills 11 in strike on alleged drug vessel from Venezuela, Trump says
Trump Says U.S. Attacked Boat Carrying Venezuelan Gang Members, Killing 11
summary: The U.S. military conducted a strike on a drug-laden vessel in the southern Caribbean, killing 11 "narcoterrorists" as it left Venezuela, according to President Trump. This action, described by Trump as taking out the vessel in international waters, escalates tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela. It follows the recent deployment of U.S. warships to the region, aligning with the administration's increased focus on counternarcotics efforts and its ongoing feud with Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: China Marks WWII Anniversary with Military Parade, Showcases New Missile
snippets: Beijing has unveiled a range of military hardware in a show of might to Western powers.
China showcased a new generation of weapons at a military parade in Bejing, including unmanned submarines and aircraft.
China held its largest ever military parade in Beijing to mark 80 years since World War II, overseen by President Xi Jin
China has held a massive military parade to commemorate 80 years since Japan surrendered at the end of World War II. North Korea's Kim and Russia's Putin were at the event hosted by China's Xi.
The parade, attended by the leaders of Russia and North Korea, had a defiant message. President Trump fired back, accusing Xi Jinping of ignoring America’s role in World War II.
China used a parade of fighter jets, missiles and goose-stepping troops to honor the country’s wartime sacrifice and issue a defiant warning to rivals.
titles: What new weapons on show at huge parade say about China's military strength
What China unveiled at its military parade
China stages huge military parade with Putin and Kim in attendance
China's Xi hosts Putin, Kim at Beijing military parade
China Projects Power at Military Parade With Putin and Kim
China’s Military Spectacle
summary: China held a significant military parade in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, commemorating 80 years since Japan's WWII surrender, attended by President Xi Jinping, North Korea's Kim Jong Un, and Russia's Vladimir Putin. This marked the first public appearance together for the three leaders. The event showcased China's military capabilities, including the unveiling of the DF-5C intercontinental strategic nuclear missile. The parade served both as a remembrance of wartime sacrifices and a demonstration of China's growing military strength.

title: Israel Plans to Annex West Bank Lands, Excludes Major Palestinian Cities
snippets: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich says maps are being drawn up to annex "maximum territory” in the West Bank.
Bezalel Smotrich said Israel should take over most of the territory, partly in response to growing international moves to recognize a Palestinian state.
At a press conference in Jerusalem, Bezalel Smotrich stood before a map that suggested the annexation of most of the West Bank with the exception of six large Palestinian cities.
titles: Israeli Finance Minister outlines plan to annex West Bank territory
Far-right Israeli Minister Calls for West Bank Annexation
Israeli far-right minister says he is drawing up West Bank annexation maps
summary: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich announced plans for Israel to annex "maximum territory" in the West Bank, excluding six large Palestinian cities. This move is partly in response to international efforts recognizing a Palestinian state. Smotrich revealed these plans at a press conference in Jerusalem, showcasing a map of the proposed annexations.

title: Jets' Vera-Tucker Suffers Major Arm Injury, May Miss Season Opener
snippets: Jets starting guard Alijah Vera-Tucker has a significant arm injury, sources told ESPN.
New York kicks off the season vs. Pittsburgh on Sunday

New York Jets right guard Alijah Vera-Tucker has an injury that could sideline him for the season opener and perhaps longer, a person with knowledge of the situation told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
titles: Sources: Jets' Vera-Tucker has significant injury
Jets OL Alijah Vera-Tucker suffers significant arm injury that could require surgery, per report
AP Source: Jets OL Alijah Vera-Tucker faces injury setback before season opener
summary: New York Jets starting guard Alijah Vera-Tucker has suffered a significant arm injury, potentially sidelining him for the season opener against Pittsburgh and possibly for an extended period. This information comes from sources cited by ESPN and a person familiar with the situation speaking to The Associated Press.

Additionally, Dave Ross and Jensen Lewis from By The Books recommend the Arizona Cardinals, Jacksonville Jaguars, and Indianapolis Colts as their top picks for NFL survivor pools in Week 1.

title: NFL's Goodell Open to Taylor Swift Super Bowl Show, No Talks Confirmed

titles: Taylor Swift Super Bowl halftime not ruled out by NFL commissioner - Axios
Roger Goodell would love a Taylor Swift Super Bowl halftime show: 'She would be welcome any time'
NFL Commissioner: Taylor Swift Super Bowl ‘A Maybe’—Here’s Why Swifties Are Convinced It’s Happening
summary: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell did not confirm any official discussions regarding Taylor Swift performing at the Super Bowl halftime show but expressed that the NFL would be thrilled to have her. Despite the lack of confirmation, fan speculation is high, with some pointing to cryptic references in Swift's work as hints she might be the next performer.

title: Rayner Refers Herself to Ethics Adviser Over £800K Tax Error
snippets: Labour politician refers herself to government’s ethics adviser over £800,000 Hove flat
Angela Rayner, the deputy to Prime Minister Keir Starmer, said the property tax underpayment was a mistake related to care arrangements for her disabled son.

Exclusive: Deputy PM refers herself to ethics adviser as confirmation puts her position under threat

  • Read Rayner’s full statement
titles: UK deputy prime minister Angela Rayner admits underpaying tax
Angela Rayner, UK’s Deputy Prime Minister, Admits Underpaying Tax
Angela Rayner admits underpaying stamp duty on £800,000 seaside flat
summary: Angela Rayner, Deputy Prime Minister under Keir Starmer, has referred herself to the government's ethics adviser due to an £800,000 underpayment in property tax for a Hove flat, attributing the mistake to care arrangements for her disabled son. This action puts her position at risk, as confirmed by her public statement.

title: Trump Criticizes China's Military Parade Attended by Putin, Kim Jong Un
snippets: Donald Trump's comments came as China held a massive military parade attended by the Russian and North Korean leaders.
Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korea's Kim Jong Un are among the leaders from more than 20 countries attending the "Victory Day" military parade in Beijing.

Trump criticises victory day event as China caps off week of diplomatic grandstanding seen as rebuke to the west

Xi Jinping said the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held China’s largest-ever military parade, joined by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong-un in a show of defiance
titles: Trump accuses Xi of conspiring against US with Putin and Kim
China's Xi says the world faces 'peace or war' as Trump claims Beijing conspiring against U.S.
Xi Jinping says world faces ‘peace or war’, as Putin and Kim join him for military parade
summary: Donald Trump criticized China's "Victory Day" military parade, which was attended by Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, among leaders from over 20 countries. The event, described as China's largest-ever military parade, was seen as a display of defiance to the West. Chinese President Xi Jinping framed the occasion as a choice between peace or war.

title: Poilievre Calls for End to Foreign Worker Program, Citing Youth Job Crisis
snippets: The proposal comes amid growing scrutiny and concerns about whether access to less expensive labour through the program can hurt the potential for wage growth.

Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is calling on the Liberals to scrap the temporary foreign worker program and stop issuing visas under the program, arguing it has caused an employment crisis among young Canadians. “The Liberals have to answer why is it that they’re shutting our own y
titles: End Canada’s temporary foreign worker program, Poilievre says
Poilievre calls on Liberals to scrap the temporary foreign worker program
summary: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre has urged the Liberals to eliminate the temporary foreign worker program, claiming it contributes to an employment crisis among young Canadians by potentially suppressing wage growth. This proposal arises amid increased scrutiny over the program's impact on the domestic labor market.

title: Cadillac Joins F1 in 2026 with Bottas, Perez, and Herta as American Test Driver
snippets: Cadillac is joining F1 in 2026 with Valtteri Bottas and Sergio Perez as its main drivers.
Colton Herta on Wednesday was named the test driver for the new Cadillac Formula 1 team — a move that gives the program its first American driver and takes Herta from IndyCar into the global series.
titles: Colton Herta leaving IndyCar Series to become test driver for new Cadillac Formula 1 team
Colton Herta moving on from IndyCar to Cadillac’s Formula 1 team
summary: Cadillac is entering Formula 1 in 2026, with Valtteri Bottas and Sergio Perez as its lead drivers. Colton Herta has been named the test driver, marking his transition from IndyCar to F1 and becoming the first American driver for Cadillac's F1 team.

summary: Karol Nawrocki visited the White House to meet with Trump during his first overseas trip. Concurrently, Putin warned that Russia is prepared to use military means to achieve its objectives if diplomacy fails. Additionally, Putin addressed the possibility of facing further EU sanctions, potentially extending to Russia's allies, including China.

title: UN: 132K Yemeni Children Risk Malnutrition Death; Houthis Attack Israel
snippets: Estimated 132,000 children below the age of five are projected to be at risk of death from acute malnutrition by June.

More than 40,000 have suffered ‘new war-related injuries’ with more than half left disabled, says UN Committee on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities

Yemen’s Houthis have claimed responsibility for a missile launched at Israel (
titles: Israeli attacks disabled 21,000 Palestinian children in Gaza war, UN says
Middle East crisis: at least 21,000 children disabled in Gaza during war, says UN committee – as it happened
summary: An estimated 132,000 children under five in Yemen are at risk of death from acute malnutrition by June, as reported by the UN. Additionally, over 40,000 people have sustained new war-related injuries, with more than half resulting in disabilities. The Houthis in Yemen have also launched a missile at Israel, claiming responsibility for the attack.

title: Astros' Valdez Apologizes for Hitting Catcher Salazar After Grand Slam Incident
snippets: Valdez and Salazar were reportedly called into their manager's office after the loss to the Yankees Tuesday

Houston Astros starter Framber Valdez said he apologized to catcher César Salazar after hitting him in the chest with a pitch Tuesday night, but he insisted that he didn’t hit his teammate on purpose.
titles: Astros' Framber Valdez denies that he intentionally crossed up catcher César Salazar after Yankees home run
Astros starter Valdez says he did not intentionally hit catcher Salazar
summary: Astros pitcher Framber Valdez apologized to catcher César Salazar for accidentally hitting him with a pitch after allowing a grand slam to Yankees' Trent Grisham. Valdez insists the incident was not intentional.

title: Netflix Enhances "Moments" Feature for Custom Clip Sharing
snippets: Netflix announced an update Wednesday to its "Moments" feature, now allowing viewers to choose a start and end point to save, rewatch and share clips.

Netflix will now let you create and share highlight clips of your favorite shows and movies right from the Netflix app on your phone. Last year, Netflix launched a feature that let you bookmark spots from shows and movies and save them to your account to watch again later or share with others. Start
titles: Netflix will let users customize and share clips on mobile
Netflix will let you make your own highlight clips
summary: Netflix updated its "Moments" feature, enabling users to select start and end points for clips from shows and movies to save, rewatch, and share directly from the app. This enhancement builds on last year's launch, which allowed bookmarking scenes for later viewing or sharing.

title: Shein Pulls Image Resembling Mangione After Backlash, Cites Third-Party Seller
snippets: An image with the likeness of Mr Mangione was used to advertise a white, short-sleeved shirt.
Shein told the BBC the image of what appears to be Mangione’s likeness was provided by a third-party seller, and the image has since been removed from Shein’s website.
titles: Luigi Mangione's likeness used to model shirt on Shein
Luigi Mangione’s Likeness Appeared As Model On Shein Website
summary: Shein removed an image resembling Mr. Mangione from their website after it was used to advertise a white shirt. The image was supplied by a third-party seller, according to Shein's statement to the BBC.

title: Alphabet Stock Up 9% After Favorable Google Antitrust Ruling
snippets: Alphabet stock climbed 9% as investors viewed the result of Google's antitrust case as broadly favorable.

U.S. District Court Judge Amit P. Mehta outlined remedies on Tuesday that would bar Google from entering or maintaining exclusive deals that tie the distribution of Search, Chrome, Google Assistant, or Gemini to other apps or revenue arrangements.
titles: Alphabet stock pops 9% after Google avoids breakup in antitrust case
Google avoids breakup, but has to give up exclusive search deals in  antitrust trial
summary: Alphabet's stock rose by 9% after a U.S. District Court ruling on Google's antitrust case was seen as favorable by investors. Judge Amit P. Mehta imposed remedies preventing Google from making exclusive deals for distributing Search, Chrome, Google Assistant, or Gemini with other apps or in revenue agreements.

title: Olympic Boxer Barred Under New Sex Testing Rules, Misses Championship
snippets:
• Olympic boxing body stands firm over new testing rules

  • Gold medalist has appealed to Cas over eligibility bar

Imane Khelif has the right to appeal against World Boxing’s decision barring her from events unless she undergoes genetic sex testing but the Algeri

Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif will not have an appeal hearing heard at the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) in time for her to compete at the World Boxing Championships which begin in Liverpool on Thursday.
titles: Imane Khelif ‘has right to appeal’ over gender tests but will miss world championships
Imane Khelif unable to compete in World Boxing Championship with appeal yet to be heard
summary: The Olympic boxing body has implemented new testing rules, which include genetic sex testing. Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif has been barred from competing under these rules and appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS). However, her appeal will not be heard in time for her to participate in the World Boxing Championships in Liverpool.

title: Google Won't Sell Chrome, Faces Deal Restrictions After Antitrust Ruling
snippets: Google won't have to sell Chrome in antitrust win
Google's penalty for being a search monopoly does not include selling Chrome.
titles: Google won't have to sell Chrome in antitrust win - Axios
Google won’t have to sell Chrome, judge rules
summary: A federal judge ruled that Google, previously found to violate the Sherman Antitrust Act, will not have to sell its Chrome browser. However, the company is prohibited from making exclusive deals for its search engine and other products like Chrome, Google Assistant, and the Gemini app on devices. This decision by U.S. District Court Judge Amit Mehta comes after considering the impact of generative AI on the market.

title: Putin, Kim Attend WWII Parade in Beijing After Xi-Modi-Putin Summit

North Korean leader thwarts ‘perpetual underestimation’ by turning adversaries into partners

summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un traveled to Beijing to attend a World War II memorial parade. This event occurred shortly after Chinese President Xi Jinping hosted a summit with India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Putin.

title: NASA Seeks New Wheel Designs for Moon Missions Through Challenge
snippets: The next era of lunar exploration demands a new kind of wheel – one that can sprint across razor-sharp regolith, shrug off extremely cold nights, and keep a rover rolling day after lunar day. The Rock and Roll with NASA Challenge seeks that breakthrough. If you can imagine a lightweight, compl

NASA’s Human Lander Challenge (HuLC) is an initiative supporting its Exploration Systems Development Mission Directorate’s (ESDMD’s) efforts to explore innovative solutions for a variety of known technology development areas for human landing systems (HLS). Landers are used to safely ferry astronaut
titles: Rock and Roll with NASA Challenge
NASA 2026 Human Lander Challenge
summary: NASA has launched the Rock and Roll with NASA Challenge to find a new wheel design for lunar exploration, capable of handling the moon's harsh terrain and extreme temperatures. This initiative supports the Human Lander Challenge (HuLC), aimed at developing innovative solutions for human landing systems (HLS) to safely transport astronauts as part of the Exploration Systems Development Mission Directorate’s (ESDMD’s) efforts.
constructiveness_reason: keywords: development, effort, initiative, solution, support
